DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to compare the effect of the 25° head-up position versus the 55° head-up position on tolerable apneic time (TAT) in bariatric patients scheduled for laparoscopic adjustable gastric band surgery following maximum preoxygenation and rapid-sequence induction (RSI) of anesthesia.
DOC.brief_title: Evaluation of Apnea Tolerance in Bariatric Patients Following Rapid-sequence Induction of Anesthesia
DOC.criteria: American Society of Anesthesiologists (ASA) physical status IIIII patients Body Mass Index (BMI) of 4060 Scheduled for an elective laparoscopic adjustable gastric band surgery Patients with abnormalities of the upper airway that require awake tracheal intubation Asthma Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease Pregnant patients
